sentences.en: an attempt to suborn a witness
Drug traders may try to suborn departing persons.
sentences.cn: 毒品商有可能试着唆使出国者.

sentences.en: He was charged with conspiracy to suborn witnesses.
sentences.cn: 他被指控阴谋收买证人作伪证.

sentences.en: The president tried to suborn false witnesses.
sentences.cn: 总统试图收买虚假证人.

sentences.en: The siloviki have shown they can squash opposition, suborn the courts and stay in charge.
sentences.cn: “西罗维基”集团表明了他们能够压制反对意见, 收买法庭和掌控一切.

trans.tran_en: to persuade someone to tell lies in a court of law or to do something else that is illegal, especially for money
to persuade someone to tell lies in a court of law or to do something else that is illegal, especially for money
